sen.j: 帝冠様式（ていかんようしき）は、昭和初期の日本で流行した、鉄筋コンクリート造の現代建築に和風の瓦屋根を載せた和洋折衷の建築様式である。
sen.e: Teikan (Imperial Crown) Style is a Japan-west blended architectural style that is a modern architecture; a reinforced concrete building, which was popular in the early Showa period, with Japanese tiled roofs.

Teikan (Imperial Crown) Style is a Japan-west blended architectural style that is a modern architecture; a reinforced concrete building, which was popular in the early Showa period, with a Japanese tiled roof.

Teikan (Imperial Crown) Style is a Japan-west blended architectural style that is a modern architecture; a reinforced concrete building, which was popular in the early Showa period, with a Japanese tiled roof.

sen.j: 1930年代のナショナリズムの台頭を背景に、モダニズム建築に対抗して日本で発生した建築様式である。
sen.e: Teikan (Imperial Crown) Style was generated against modernism architecture in the context of Nationalism appeared in 1930's.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Teikan (Imperial Crown) Style was generated against modernism architecture in the context of Nationalism that appeared in the 1930's.
Teikan (Imperial Crown) Style was generated against modernism architecture in the context of Nationalism that appeared in the 1930's.

sen.j: 現代的なビルに日本の伝統的な屋根を載せた非常に特徴的な意匠を持つ。
sen.e: Teikan (Imperial Crown) Style; a modern building with Japanese traditional tile roofs, has extremely characteristic features.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Teikan (Imperial Crown) Style; a modern building with a Japanese traditional tile roof, has extremely characteristic features.
Teikan (Imperial Crown) Style; a modern building with a Japanese traditional tile roof, has extremely characteristic features.

sen.j: 「軍服を着た建物」という異名をもつ建築物様式としても知られる。
sen.e: It is also known as an architectural style with the naming of `building wearing gun puku' (minitary uniform).
It is also known as an architectural style with the name of `building wearing gun puku' (military uniform).
It is also known as an architectural style with the name of "building wearing gun puku" (military uniform).

sen.j: 実用を兼ねて容易に日本的な意匠を表現できる事から、日本国内のほか、日本の同盟国であった満州国でも用いられ、現存するものも多い。
sen.e: Since it is practical, yet easily expressing Japanese design, it has been used in Manchukuo, which was a Japan's allied country, as well as in Japan; some buildings still exist.
Since it is practical, yet easily expresses Japanese design, it has been used in Manchukuo (Manchuria), which was Japan's allied country, as well as in Japan; some buildings still exist.
Since it is practical, yet easily expresses Japanese design, it has been used in Manchukuo (Manchuria), which was Japan's allied country, as well as in Japan; some buildings still exist.

sen.j: しかし昭和初期に発生した事から、それ以前に日本の植民地として組み込まれた朝鮮や台湾島などには少ない。
sen.e: However, they were built in the early Showa period, and as a result, few buildings existed in Korea or Taiwan island that were colonized before the appearance of buildings in Teikan (Imperial Crown) Style.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, they were built in the early Showa period, and as a result, few buildings existed in Korea or Taiwan, which were colonized before the appearance of buildings in Teikan (Imperial Crown) Style.

However, they were built in the early Showa period, and as a result, few buildings existed in Korea or Taiwan, which were colonized before the appearance of buildings in Teikan (Imperial Crown) Style.

sen.j: それらの地域では日本統治時代の残照として新古典主義建築様式が目立つ。
sen.e: In Korea or Taiwan region, buildings in the neoclassical architectural style as remainings of the period of Japan's rule are prominent.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。新古典主義建築様式→neoclassical architectural style と訳出しています。（定訳不明のため）
sen.e: In Korea and Taiwan, buildings in the neoclassical architectural style remaining from the period of Japan's rule are prominent.
In Korea and Taiwan, buildings in the neoclassical architectural style remaining from the period of Japan's rule are prominent.

sen.j: 神奈川県庁舎（小尾嘉郎、1928年）
sen.e: The Kanagawa Prefectural Office Building (Yoshiro KOBI in 1928)
